Class UserInterfaceMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • UserInterfaceMethods

  • public class UserInterfaceMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    This class groups all methods that are required to run the system, without creating or editing Person or Project objects.

    The methods in this class consists of repeating or lengthy display options as well as checking if user input is valid or not. The methods do pull information form the database, but do not create or modify it.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nadia Botha

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserInterfaceMethods

        public UserInterfaceMethods()

    • Method Detail

      • displayOptions

        public static void displayOptions()
        This method displays the options of the main menu.

        The options include creating a new object, editing an existing project, display projects that still have to be completed, dispay projects that are overdue and to exit the program.

      • getUserChoice

        public static int getUserChoice(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method requests the user to input an integer to execute an option from the main menu.

        The method request the user to input an integer form 1-7. After receiving the input, it checks if the input is valid. If not, it requests the user to try again.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        Returns:
        returns the integer for the main menu option chosen
        See Also:
        #displayEditOptions()

      • displayEditOptions

        private static void displayEditOptions()
        This method displays all the project and person options which can be edited.

        The options include to update the project fee, the total paid to date, the project deadline, an architect's contact details, a contractor's contact details and a customer's contact details.

      • getEditOption

        public static int getEditOption(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method requests the user to input an integer to execute an option from the displayEditOptions.

        The method request the user to input an integer form 1-6. After receiving the input, it checks if the input is valid. If not, it requests the user to try again.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        Returns:
        returns the integer for the displayEditOption menu
        See Also:
        #displayEditOptions()

      • displayProjectSummary

        public static void displayProjectSummary()
        This methods displays a summary of all the projects in the database.

        The project number, name, deadline, customer name and project status is displayed.

      • displayArchitectSummary

        public static void displayArchitectSummary()
        Display a summary of all the architects in the database.

      • generateInvoice

        public static void generateInvoice(Person projectCustomer,
                                   java.lang.Double amountPayable)
        This method displays an invoice when called.

        The method is only called when there is an outstanding amount on the project. It displays all of the customer contact details as well as the amount payable.

        Parameters:
        projectCustomer - Person object which is the customer for the project.
        amountPayable - Double value that represents the amount that is still payable on the project.
        See Also:
        #getPersonName(), #getEmailAddress(), #getPhysicalAddress(), #getTelephoneNumber()
